author: archyworldyscom
title: Where are you from: Digital platform has serious problems ‚Äì Presentation faces obstacles ‚Äì
text:
If some think that Greece is in the 21 THE century and in digital technology should probably revisit these views. Since the launch of the much-hyped platform that aims to ‚Äúfight‚Äù tax evaders , Documento has received many calls about malfunctions and the platform not allowing you to log in or save.
Read also: Pothen Esches: Declaration platform 2024 opened ‚Äì The 8 stages of the process
In the Greece of 2024, even the much-hyped platforms that are supposed to integrate us into the civilized world do not function properly or simply function with enormous problems that nullify the very usefulness of digital technology.
One such government failure is the much publicized ‚ÄúNowhere‚Äù platform which they are now thinking of fixing!
The most important but essential problems: It is not possible to make a temporary save if all elements are not filled. That‚Äôs how you lose them and have to start over. ‚ÄúFinalizing‚Äù also has a problem with the message the user receives that a ‚Äúglitch‚Äù has occurred. And these are only part of the errors presented by the platform since the entire filling is a slalom of luck to end up sending it.
Officially the problems will be resolved soon with the update (fix) of the errors but one wonders how it is possible that it has been released for use before the necessary tests and corrections have been carried out by the experts.
According to the announcement from the Ministry of Digital Governance: Start of submission of declarations for the year 2024 on the new POTHEN platform
Available, through the new POTHEN platform, www.pothen.gr the possibility of submitting annual declarations for the year 2024 (use 2023) by debtors.
The submission of initial declarations for the years 2023 and 2024 will be available in the next few days pending the submission of data by financial institutions to the General Secretariat of Information Systems and Digital Government of the Ministry of Digital Government.
Please note that the submission of annual returns for the year 2023 (use 2022) is already available through the new POTHEN platform. The deadline for submitting the Asset Declaration is 31.12.2024.
Read also:
USA: A banana attached to the wall sold for 6.2 million ‚Äì Who is the buyer (Photo)
Weather: At the gates of the ‚ÄúP‚Äù type atmospheric disturbance ‚Äì Rain, cold and snow are on the way
A gift to doctors with pandemic prescriptions ‚Äì Afternoon interventions with Recovery Fund funds and more than double charges
Debate on SYRIZA: All ‚Äú4‚Äù with‚Ä¶ savoir vibrate for the new SYRIZA SLAPP via AADE: New fine of 161,000 euros to Documento in retaliation for our revelations

author: Wayne Garreth
title: Students Brave Through Heavy Rainstorm That Broke Their Tent While Camping in Kota Tinggi
text:
Camping gives people the opportunity to unwind and experience nature at its fullest extent. Yet, it‚Äôs always important to come to campsites prepared and ready for anything, as the outdoors can be quite unforgiving at different intervals of the year.
A couple of students from Polytechnic Ibrahim Sultan recently experienced such a feat when they went camping at Batu Layar Beach in Kota Tinggi, Johor, and got a lot more than what they bargained for. In a clip shared to one of the students‚Äô TikTok page
@___zaiddd, the user gave some insight into how the massive rainfall turned their peaceful camping trip upside down.
At the beginning of the video, the duo revealed how the heavy rain weighed on their delicate camping tent, requiring them to hold it up from the inside using their bare hands. As the night continued, the storm only got heavier as the the tent tore in certain places, causing rain to come into their shelter.
Slowing down for just a brief moment, the storm rushed in once again at around 3am.
Responding to the video, multiple Malaysians stated that the boys must have chosen an improper time to go camping, while others asked if they had brought a flysheet with them, which is an outer fabric layer for tents that act as an additional protective layer. Unfortunately, the duo said they had not.
However, a few people also defended the boys, saying that even those with a full camping set will not be able to protect themselves from harsh weather when it arrives.
‚ÄúSome of us with a complete set also will be scared to go camping during raining season. Only those with enough protection can go and do it bravely,‚Äù commented another user.
Watch the full TikTok video below:
Dua orang pelajar Politeknik Ibrahim Sultan berada dalam situasi cemas ketika cuba untuk tidur di dalam khemah di Pantai Batu Layar, Kota Tinggi ketika musim hujan ributü§£
[#foryourpage] [#endofdiploma]
If you‚Äôre planning on going camping soon, maybe reschedule!
Also read:
Johor Man Bravely Walks Through Chest-Level Flood Waters to Get to Work Despite Harsh Weather

author: Mover Tracker
title: Amylyx Pharmaceuticals (AMLX) Soars 2.85% Amid Legal Scrutiny
text:
Amylyx Pharmaceuticals (AMLX) Soars 2.85% Amid Legal Scrutiny
Amylyx Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (AMLX) shares surged 2.85% today, marking the fourth consecutive day of gains, with a cumulative increase of 32.46% over the past four days. The stock price reached its highest level since December 2024, with an intraday gain of 6.50%.
One of the key factors influencing Amylyx's stock price is the investigation launched by Bronstein, Gewirtz & Grossman, LLC. This investigation focuses on potential corporate wrongdoing by [amylyx] and certain of its officers and/or directors. Such legal scrutiny can significantly impact investor confidence and lead to fluctuations in the stock price.
Additionally, Alpha Wave Global LP's decision to reduce its position in Amylyx by 77.8% in the fourth quarter has raised concerns among investors. This substantial reduction by a prominent investment firm can affect market perception and potentially influence the stock's value.
Another factor to consider is Amylyx's 3-Year Share Buyback Ratio, which stands at -7.50 as of April 22, 2025. This ratio suggests the company's strategy regarding share repurchases, which can impact investor sentiment and stock performance.
Furthermore, a stockholder has filed a claim against Amylyx, alleging that the company overstated the commercial prospects and prescription rate of its RELYVRIO product. This legal action could have significant implications for Amylyx's reputation and stock performance, as it may affect investor trust and market sentiment.

author: surreylive@reachplc.com (Kieran Graves)
title: Surrey weather: Met Office issues 16-hour wind warning for New Year weekend with 50mph gusts
text: The Met Office has issued a 16-hour yellow weather warning for wind across Surrey and the south of England for the New Year weekend with gusts of 50mph widely forecast. The alert comes into force from 11am (December 30) and means ‚Äústrong and gusty‚Äù winds are expected until 3am on Sunday (December 31). The alert covers the majority of the county up to [Chertsey](https://www.getsurrey.co.uk/all-about/chertsey) as a strong spell of wind moves east across England and Wales. The forecaster has warned of travel disruption and possible short-term losses of power or services. It said some delays are likely on road, rail, air, and ferry transport and that journeys on buses and trains will ‚Äúprobably‚Äù take longer. ‚ÄúDelays for high-sided vehicles on exposed routes and bridges likely,‚Äù The Met Office continued. Read more: [6 of Surrey's beautiful towns and villages you'll want to move to in 2024](https://www.getsurrey.co.uk/news/property-news/6-surreys-beautiful-towns-villages-28359745) Read more: [The Surrey market town 'you may never want to leave' among UK's happiest places to live](https://www.getsurrey.co.uk/whats-on/whats-on-news/surrey-market-town-you-never-28350635) ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs likely that some coastal routes, sea fronts, and coastal communities will be affected by spray and/or large waves. Some short-term loss of power and other services is possible.‚Äù Gusts of 45 to 50 mph are widely forecast but conditions will be squally near the cold front bringing the weather and gusts may hit 60mph. Stronger gusts of up to 75mph are ‚Äúlikely near coasts in the west and south‚Äù. Drivers and those looking to travel have been advised to check conditions and timetables before they leave to avoid delays. Those on or visiting coastal areas have been urged to stay safe by being aware of large waves. Get more news from SurreyLive straight to your inbox for free [ here. ](https://www.getsurrey.co.uk/newsletter-preference-centre/?view=Solus&mailingListId=5a60c8a3-ae63-4616-b4b5-05a94ba6d239&utm_source=solusarticle)

author: CNN Newsource
title: Annual Christmas dinner for homeless in Hollywood is volunteer effort by local church, synagogue
text:
By Josh Haskell
Click here for updates on this story
 HOLLYWOOD, California ( KABC ) ‚Äî An estimated 1,000 Hollywood residents in need spent Christmas Day at Hollywood United Methodist Church in partnership with Temple Israel of Hollywood for the 38th annual Christmas Day Dinner.
That‚Äôs where we met Red Wine Jones, who moved to Los Angeles from East Texas a year ago with her daughter and two grandchildren.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been living on the streets but thank God he‚Äôs blessing us with a place, and I‚Äôve been helping them,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúGoing through a whole lot. It‚Äôs a lot more expensive than Texas, and it‚Äôs been really hard but good prayers would help, and I‚Äôm praying for everybody.‚Äù
Volunteers treated the homeless and local families in need to live music and a hot meal, and those volunteers are from both congregations who are dedicated to being positive members of the Hollywood community.
‚ÄúAs we live around L.A. and all of our Hollywood neighbors and the tent encampments, it‚Äôs heartbreaking, really,‚Äù said Ricka Fisher, a member of Temple Israel of Hollywood and the co-chair of the Christmas Day Dinner. ‚ÄúThe way we can actually be of value to our Judaic community is to spend this day and give back to all those who celebrate Christmas, especially those who are homeless, who are hungry, who are financially challenged, who have health challenges and who otherwise might just need a safe space to have a holiday.‚Äù
Sylvie Belfer said she volunteers simply because it‚Äôs Christmas and she wants to make people‚Äôs day.
‚ÄúHelping comes first and respect comes first,‚Äù she said.
In addition to a hot meal, those in need are also received toys, clothes and hygiene kits.
‚ÄúI love togetherness and I love people, and I thank God for what they‚Äôre doing for us,‚Äù said Jones.
The attendees were of all ages from different backgrounds, sharing the hardships of life, and a hope that next year, things will be better.
‚ÄúWe need food to thrive, not just survive, so this meal brings a lot, not just to our hearts, but to our souls,‚Äù said Issis Mant who‚Äôs homeless. ‚ÄúEvery day, we need to be supportive of each other, doesn‚Äôt matter what skin color we are, doesn‚Äôt matter what nationality we are, doesn‚Äôt matter what religion we are.‚Äù
Please note: This content carries a strict local market embargo. If you share the same market as the contributor of this article, you may not use it on any platform.

author: SoyChile
title: Hombre pr√≥fugo de la justicia argentina fue detenido por PDI e Interpol Chile en Loncoche
text: Personal de la Brigada Investigadora de Delitos Sexuales (Brisex) Temuco, junto a personal de Interpol Chile, lograron la detenci√≥n de un hombre chileno, de 50 a√±os, quien se manten√≠a pr√≥fugo de la justicia argentina, acusado por diversos delitos de √≠ndole sexual, que habr√≠an sido cometidos en el a√±o 2018 en el pa√≠s vecino.El prefecto Luis Garrido, jefe de la Prefectura Provincial Caut√≠n, explic√≥ que ‚Äúel imputado registraba un encargo vigente, una alerta roja solicitada por Interpol de Argentina, desde el mes de marzo de este a√±o, por requerimientos ante reiterados delitos sexuales cometidos en ese pa√≠s. Este sujeto, a su vez hab√≠a sido detenido en nuestro pa√≠s por un delito de abuso sexual perpetrado en el a√±o 2018‚Äù.Una vez establecida su ubicaci√≥n, a trav√©s de herramientas anal√≠ticas investigativas, se inform√≥ a la Brigada Investigadora de Delitos Sexuales de Temuco, quienes, en coordinaci√≥n con Interpol Chile, obtuvieron, por parte de la Corte Suprema de nuestro pa√≠s, una orden de detenci√≥n, logrando materializar con √©xito su captura.El detenido fue puesto a disposici√≥n de los tribunales, para luego proceder con las instancias administrativas respectivas para su extradici√≥n hacia Argentina.

author: Lidia Herrera
title: East Texans to ring in new year with fireworks | cbs19.tv
text: TEXAS, USA ‚Äî East Texans are preparing to ring in the new year with fireworks across East Texas. Before you begin to pop fireworks, make sure you understand the responsibility that comes with fireworks. Texas Firework Laws According to [Texas Department of Insurance](https://www.tdi.texas.gov/fire/fmfireworksell.html), retail fireworks permit holders are promited to sell fireworks for New Year from December 20 to January 1. To purcase fireworks, you have to be 16-years-old or older. In several East Texas cities it is prohibited to use fireworks within city limits such as - Jacksonville - Longview - Marshal - Tyler - White Oak In the city of Tyler, if you're caught setting off fireworks within the city limits it's a Class C Misdemeanor, which is a fine up to $500. In several counties, fireworks are allowed outside city limits such as - Gregg - Harrison - Rusk - Upshur - Panola However, even in these areas, it is still illegal to: - Shoot fireworks from or toward a vehicle and boat - Shoot fireworks from a public road, public land, park or lake - Shoot fireworks within 600 feet of a church, hospital, child-care facility, primary or high school without written permission The Texas Department of Insurance gives tips on how to safely use fireworks: - Always buy fireworks from an established retail outlet. - Only ignite fireworks outdoors in cleared areas away from houses, buildings, dry leaves, and flammable materials - Keep water handy for fires and emergencies. - Never experiment or attempt to make homemade fireworks. - Light only one firework at a time. - Never re-ignite malfunctioning fireworks; soak them in water and throw away. - Never give fireworks to small children. - Store fireworks in a cool, dry place. - Never throw fireworks at another person. - Never carry fireworks in your pocket. - Never shoot fireworks in metal or glass containers. - Wear eye protection when shooting fireworks. - After shooting them, soak fireworks in water before putting them in the trash. In addition to firework safety, officials are reminding locals celebratory gunfire is illegal and could cause seriously bodily harm or death. "Make sure you get eye protection. Hands are protected and that you're not in an area that's dry, water down the area where you're at and having a extinguishment source," said Paul Findley, Jacksonville Fire Chief. Another safe option Findley mentioned is going to watch a professional fireworks display instead. For a list of locations where fireworks are being sold in Texas, click [here](https://www.tdi.texas.gov/fire/documents/fmlicfwkplan.pdf). For a list of New Year's Eve celebrations, click [here](/article/life/holidays/east-texas-celebrates-new-years-eve-with-several-events/501-8e41a55b-253b-454a-8c55-cc1a7bfd3d6a).
